p: Coronavirus replicates by recruiting nonstructural proteins like 3CLpro, PLpro, helicase, and RdRpÂ [ 12]. These four non-structural proteins are key enzymes within the viral life cycle. In addition, the spike glycoprotein is indispensable for virus-cell receptor interactions during viral entry. These viral proteins were therefore considered as important targets to develop antiviral agents [ 4]. Therapeutic options in response to the SARS-CoV-2 outbreak are the need of the hour. Here, we discuss the potential for repurposing existing antiviral agents to treat SARS-CoV-2 infection with their site of action as shown in Figure 2, most of which are already moving into clinical trials [ 4].
